Issues.Title: V-if sets data when using '=' instead of '=='
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://gist.github.com/wrrrn/a1b6e4c25eed7bf2780f4d63bb9bdc82](https://gist.github.com/wrrrn/a1b6e4c25eed7bf2780f4d63bb9bdc82)

### Steps to reproduce
Open the console and click the 'select' dropdown.

### What is expected?
The `v-if` block will render only if `filter` is 1.

### What is actually happening?
You can see the `watch` will fire twice, once with the initial data you expected, then the `v-if` will reset the data to whatever it started out as (in this case: 1). 

---
I'm aware not using `==` or `===` is bad practice, but I also think it's odd that having a `v-if` statement set data within a template.

Â¯\_(ãƒ„)_/Â¯

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "V-if sets data when using '=' instead of '=='" (#7992)

Issues.Title: Methods cant access to data using cdn and es6
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/Allanrp/yj2bkx68/](https://jsfiddle.net/Allanrp/yj2bkx68/)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a simple html page and import [vue](https://unpkg.com/vue@2.5.16/dist/vue.js)
2. Create a vue.js file and import it in html
3. Create a span tag in html and add {{ methodx()}} to it
4. In vue.js file create a message variable and add some text in it
5. In vue.js file create a method named methodx using es6 syntax (Example above)
```
methodx:  () => {
      return this.message;
    }
```

### What is expected?
The text in message variable must be shown

### What is actually happening?
The method return undefined.

---
If you instead of using this.message use a string, it is shown.
When you use the function() notation, it shows the variable.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Methods cant access to data using cdn and es6" (#7991)

Issues.Title: The values of some attributes are replaced with the attribute name, which breaks MathML
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://gist.github.com/VelizarHristov/edaf4cf0d7b9f90c1e5d6070c027237f](https://gist.github.com/VelizarHristov/edaf4cf0d7b9f90c1e5d6070c027237f)

### Steps to reproduce
Open the HTML in a browser (Internet connection is required to fetch the libraries).

### What is expected?
[] should be displayed

### What is actually happening?
open] is displayed

---
It comes from this line of code: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/aa1356e83de1112660e7a88ff955f49d64bb5b1f/src/platforms/web/server/modules/attrs.js#L49

The list of rewritten attributes is here: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/7116af4e07520040ed7328c39d0a456808bfe1e1/src/platforms/web/util/attrs.js#L22

This is a general problem when including a block of XML in the HTML.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The values of some attributes are replaced with the attribute name, which breaks MathML" (#7990)

Issues.Title: Compilation of mustaches in mustaches expression doesn't work
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/9bzw21no/33/](https://jsfiddle.net/9bzw21no/33/)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Use a string literal containing `}}` in the data binding

```html
{{ 'hello}}' + '{{world' }}
```

`hello}}{{world`

### What is actually happening?
`hello)+""+_s(world`

- [svelte example](https://svelte.technology/repl?version=1.60.2&gist=35cef4e8c0ff85c17f948b5f4146b1f0)

Issues.Title: "class" and "style" attributes have no effect on functional SFC components
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/padcom/vue-functional-no-class-passed](https://github.com/padcom/vue-functional-no-class-passed)

### Steps to reproduce
* Clone the repository
* ```npm install```
* ```npm start```
* Open http://localhost:4000


### What is expected?
Functional component is painted in green/red by applying the ```items``` CSS class and ```color: red``` style

### What is actually happening?
The ```items``` CSS class nor ```style``` is not applied

---
I am mostly using the added class in components for BEM-style annotations where a component is at the same time an element from the point of view of the container and a block from its personal point of view thus allowing me to delegate certain properties to the container, like positioning for example.
I'd like to use that same principle in functional components, for example with ```transition-group``` that has the option to specify the ```tag``` attribute. It works with statefull components but functional components fail to pass the ```class``` and ```style``` properties when rendering.

Please note that the functional components declared in the example repository do contain the ```v-bind="data.attrs"``` and ```v-on="listeners"``` attributes on the root node as described in the [documentation](https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/render-function.html#Passing-Attributes-and-Events-to-Child-Elements-Components).

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ""class" and "style" attributes have no effect on functional SFC components" (#7985)

Issues.Title: add `options` property to the render context of functional component
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Custom properties in the options of functional component can't be accessed easily.

### What does the proposed API look like?
In the render function of functional component, options can be accessed by `context.options`, just like `vm.$options`(https://vuejs.org/v2/api/index.html#vm-options)

related issue #7492

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "add `options` property to the render context of functional component" (#7984)

Issues.Title: Create a discord-gitter chat bridge
Issues.Body:
I've used  matterbridge with great success!
https://github.com/42wim/matterbridge

Someone can fork this to run it easily on heroku:
https://github.com/edgi-govdata-archiving/matterbridge-heroku

Gitter has the perk that community activity is visible with only one click -- no sign-up. And it uses 3rd-party identity providers (github and twitter), so when someone feels like chatting, it's only one more click. It's def the lowest barrier chat room, so a bridge would still keep that in your community toolset :)

And obviously, ppl could upgrade into discord as they come across the needs for its value adds (which presumably exist) :tada:
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Create a discord-gitter chat bridge" (#7983)

Issues.Title: fix(core): fix dependency collection for computed properties (#7960)
Issues.Body:
This fix addresses a regression introduced in https://github.com/vuejs/vue/commit/653aac2c57d15f0e93a2c1cc7e6fad156658df19, by altering the order of `watcher.evaluate` and `watcher.depend`, thus preventing the `Vue.set`s in a computed property getter from
accidentally clearing the `deps` array of the computed watcher.

Issues.Title: Memory and node count increase when showing and hiding with v-if
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.13

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/timbarclay/pen/WzamJy](https://codepen.io/timbarclay/pen/WzamJy)

### Steps to reproduce
The link is to a codepen of a very simple Vue app that simply contains a button that shows/hides a basic component based on a boolean data property.
Open Chrome dev tools, go to the performance tab, tick the Memory checkbox and then click record.
Toggle the button a number of times and then stop recording.

### What is expected?
I would expect the Nodes count to rise when the component is shown and fall again when it is hidden, or potentially to rise the first time it is shown but then stay there.

### What is actually happening?
The Nodes, Listeners and JS Heap counts all rise each time the component is shown and don't go down.

---
Perhaps I shouldn't expect browsers to clear up nodes/heap objects/listeners straight away to prevent too much GC churn, but in my production app, I have a form that gets shown/hidden like this that seems to increase the Node count by a little over 13,000 every time it's opened, and I haven't yet seen it go down. Hopefully, I'm misinterpreting what I'm looking at, in which case I would be glad of the reassurance.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Memory and node count increase when showing and hiding with v-if" (#7976)

Issues.Title: Code-based HTML Entity improperly re-escaped by VUE when in HTML attribute.
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/273361/](https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/273361/)

### Steps to reproduce
Use unicode-based HTML entities in an HTML attribute (eg title) in the template for a VUE.

### What is expected?
The ampersand character which is the leading character of the entity should NOT be re-escaped when inserted into the DOM.

### What is actually happening?
The leading ampersand character of the code-based HTML entity IS being re-escaped when being put into the DOM.

---
This is the same issue I reported on 7969 but it got closed.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Code-based HTML Entity improperly re-escaped by VUE when in HTML attribute." (#7970)

Issues.Title: Ordinary form POST method not working... Laravel 5.5 + VueJs  Last version
Issues.Body:
Hello there !

I have these simple raw  codes on my vue instance for testing.  


`<form name="aa" id="aa" action="http://192.168.1.100/login" method="POST">
                                    <input name="_token" type="hidden" v-model="csrfToken">
                                    <button type="submit"> SUBMIT </button>
</form>`

it's looking on my browser like this...

`<form data-v-1b610de5="" name="aa" id="aa" action="http://192.168.1.100/login" method="POST"><input data-v-1b610de5="" name="_token" type="hidden" value="3jQ5KJV9TiCcTXF0fICpXYgX0C1irPpdHLkZWiAg"> <button data-v-1b610de5="" type="submit"> SUBMIT </button></form>`

if there is _token value is TRUE, not sending POST data to action url ....

Just REFRESHING page that's all.. 

If im writing wrong data to _token, sending POST method this form .


any idea about it? How can I fix this problem ? 

Interesting - really very ordinary , easy web form ... 

Thank you so much !!!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Ordinary form POST method not working... Laravel 5.5 + VueJs  Last version" (#7978)

Issues.Title: Content of Contenteditable is Dobeling without Variable change
Issues.Body:
Vue.js v2.5.16 Hello i have a really weird bug. I have 4 Contenteditable which i copy to a variable. IF i write "1234" in Path2 > change to Title1 and than disfucus Title1 > Path2 will change to "12341234" But the variable "this.PC.Path2" will stay at 1234 This Error occurs on only content editable - Path2. I have changed the Name so only the Function "updateHtml" can interact with it(on my site) - no effekt. I have now Invested 2 Hours to track this wieder behavior down, i haven't found similar problems on the Net - so hopefully you can help me. ```
{{PC.Path}}
{{PC.Path2}}
Title1: {{ PC.Title2 }}
Title2: {{ PC.Title1 }} ``` ``` updateHtml: function(e) { var foo = e.target.getAttribute("name") console.log("PATH2---", this.PC.Path2); this.PC[foo] = e.target.innerText; console.log("PATH2---", this.PC.Path2); console.log("UPDATING this.PC." + foo, " to-->", this.PC[foo]); }, ``` The Complete Code with Backend is on: https://github.com/i5heu/wikinota/tree/V2 Only the Code of this Module: https://github.com/i5heu/wikinota-web/blob/04629560ec0d6383b4ad8f92cb2647a616c559ce/js/pedit.js Here is the Chrome Performance Profile. (with Pictures of the weird stuff) [wierd-bug.zip](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/files/1885385/wierd-bug.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Content of Contenteditable is Dobeling without Variable change " (#7977)

Issues.Title: prop of component, in conditionally rendered slot, stops being reactive
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.14+

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/cLdbL2t2/22/](https://jsfiddle.net/cLdbL2t2/22/)

### Steps to reproduce
Clicking "update message" button adds dots after message.
Once "alter" button is clicked, the message is no longer updated.

### What is expected?
Updating message continues working even after slot is altered.

### What is actually happening?
Prop value stops being reactive, without error nor warning.

---
This behavior takes place after v2.5.14  including v2.5.17-beta.0.
Any version 2.5.13 and lower works as expected.

Unit test can be found in my github https://github.com/honeroku/vue-slot-investigate

I am understanding this is edge case and refactoring structure to avoid placing identical slot in conditional positions resolves my problem.
However, this behavior was not occurring in older versions and suddenly changed without error or warning,
so I am considering this is a bug and reporting to let you know.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "prop of component, in conditionally rendered slot, stops being reactive" (#7975)

Issues.Title: Allow for custom rule of blocks parsing
Issues.Body:
I am currently working on a Nativescript+Vue template, which includes a specific webpack config that allows for differentiated templates based on the target (web or native). Single file components are extremely useful and being able to add a custom rule to the parsing of their blocks would make it possible to write a single file containing a `native` template alongside a `web` template, both of which sharing the same <script> logic or <style> rules. So far, the only workaround is to change the 'vue-loader' in webpack but by adding this it would be possible to use the actual official 'vue-loader' and change only the necessary part.

Issues.Title: Compilation fails on empty values on v-bind
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.13

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/jt3hjuwg/](https://jsfiddle.net/jt3hjuwg/)

### Steps to reproduce
I am referencing this closed issue:

https://github.com/vuejs/vue/issues/3969

I feel like something should be done about this issue because it has left me with some white pages along the way and without a clear error message. If you pass in a null value as a prop the entire compilation breaks down with your evaluated html simply being dumped into the console.

Is there really not a better way to handle this? Obviously a user should or could check for these values before actually showing the component but in large application a piece of data can sometimes be null either by accident or oversight

If nothing can be done about this could someone at least please explain why this happens because in my eyes a component not getting a prop does not justify the entire compilation failing.

### What is expected?
The application should not fail compilation.

### What is actually happening?
It fails compilation.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Compilation fails on empty values on v-bind" (#7973)

Issues.Title: [Some] HTML entity in template gets re-escaped [incorrectly] by vue.js
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/270981/](https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/270981/)

### Steps to reproduce
In the html template, provide an html "title" attribute that contains an HTML entity using ascii codes. 

### What is expected?
Vue should not mess with or re-escape/entify the literal ampersand character in the HTML template.

### What is actually happening?
Vue sees the ampersand character in the html attribute and changes it to the HTML amp entity - resulting in a rendered ampersand character.

---
Trying to put a newline character into a title attribute within my template file.
Seems like Vue has some recognized entities (the named ones perhaps) which it leaves alone, but entities using ASCII codes get corrupted.
Entities using ASCII codes seem to behave fine when placed as content inside a tag - but not when placed into an HTML attribute.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Some] HTML entity in template gets re-escaped [incorrectly] by vue.js" (#7969)

Issues.Title: Better lifecycle events
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Hello. I came with a little specific but, I think, useful ideas.  
Vue has undocumented (or?) lifecycle events. I have some nested high-ordered components
- Custom inputÐ¿
- Search component with custom input
I wanted to add "autofocus" on `@hook:mounted`  for search input but solution is not nice because of 2 problems:
- `$listeners` also adds `@hook:mounted` event. It causes both mounted events call ([demo](https://codesandbox.io/s/921k2n76p4))
- It would be better to have component instance passed to event

### What does the proposed API look like?
1. Add `.self` flag (or with another name) for lifecycle events that will compare component instances (like `.self` compares targets for native events)
- 2nd: Add component instance to events. It will allow us not to use `$refs` for use cases like this one

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Better lifecycle events" (#7966)

Issues.Title: .bubble event modifier to pass along events, especially for those with args
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Bubbling up an event from a deep child can be really cumbersome (without an event bus) because you have to emit the same event from every parent up the tree until it reaches its target. An event modifier like `.bubble` would be really nice.

### What does the proposed API look like?
This:
```vue
<child @hi.bubble/>
```

Instead of repeating this:
```vue
<child @hi="(...args) => $emit('hi', ...args)"/>

// or even:

<child @hi="$emit('hi')"/>
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ".bubble event modifier to pass along events, especially for those with args" (#7965)

Issues.Title: Transition on overflowed elements prevents scroll
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/johnjleider/pen/MVqyXB](https://codepen.io/johnjleider/pen/MVqyXB)

### Steps to reproduce
- Click the button to open the menu
- As the element is transitioning in, begin to scroll (try not to move your mouse while scrolling)

### What is expected?
The scrollable area continues to scroll

### What is actually happening?
The scrolling area will get stuck. The scrolling event is still being fired but is not actually scrolling the content. Once you move your mouse and start to scroll again, it works as expected.

If you wait for the transition to finish before scrolling, the bug does not present itself.
![scroll](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9064066/38321350-643295b6-3805-11e8-92ff-ddd2fb3eecd2.gif)

---
We had a report of the `v-select` component not scrolling. We have confirmed this is only happening in Chrome 65, but extends back to even 0.15 of the framework (Vuetify). I created the attached codepen to determine if it was framework specific or generally reproducible.

While their may be other css properties that trigger this issue, I have only had success with opacity and happens specifically with the `enter` declaration. If you remove the entry animation, this does not occur.

**Removed entry animation** https://codepen.io/johnjleider/pen/ZxMObZ?editors=1111

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Transition on overflowed elements prevents scroll" (#7964)

Issues.Title: Enhancement on reusable router view
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Use a shared router view among different route paths. I'm creating a dashboard dynamically, which only need three views:

1. List View
2. Create View
3. Edit View

Let's create three files: `PageList.vue`, `PageCreate.vue`, `PageEdit.vue`, and use them in routes.

### What does the proposed API look like?
```js
routes = [
   {path: '/users', component: PageList},
   {path: '/users/create', component: PageCreate},
   {path: '/users/:id', component: PageEdit},
   {path: '/posts', component: PageList},
   {path: '/posts/create', component: PageCreate},
   {path: '/posts/:id', component: PageEdit},
]
```

Currently, this won't work properly. Actually, it has a bug, the `poll` function will run infinitely when switching routes.


## Current Bug

If you have such routes, and using navigation guard, the `poll` function will run infinitely when switching routes.

```js
routes = [
   {path: '/users', component: PageList},
   {path: '/posts', component: PageList},
]
```

If you add a `console.log` here https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/dev/src/history/base.js#L315
it will print log infinitely, because `instances[key]` will always be undefined.

My current solution:

```js
routes = [
   {path: '/users', component: Object.assign({}, PageList)},
   {path: '/posts', component: Object.assign({}, PageList)},
]
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Enhancement on reusable router view" (#2142)

Issues.Title: Allow paths with trailing slash.
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Right now if I specify a route with "path: '/about/'" and I redirect to it the browser URL will be set to '.../about'.

This creates various issues. For example, Google Analytics will report usage statistics about '/about' and '/about/' (the latter we get if the user arrives on our page at /about as the browser appends a slash). Clearly this should be fixed on our end and I'm sure there are a lot of other cases where this creates problems. 

### What does the proposed API look like?
Disclaimer: I don't know if this breaks something else.

It would be great if "path: '/about/'" would add a trailing slash when redirecting to the route.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow paths with trailing slash." (#2141)

Issues.Title: Router guard not working when coming from page its supposed to redirect if condition does not match
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/jrfd3x89/](https://jsfiddle.net/jrfd3x89/)

### Steps to reproduce
So I have three components, Secured, NonSecured and Dummy associated to three routes. Secured routes should be accessed only by users who has access. And the router guard checks for that. If the user does not have permission then navigating the user to NonSecured page. 
 if you navigate from Dummy to Secured you would be redirected to NonSecured which is what supposed to happen. but if you navigate from NonSecured to Secured page, then you would be allowed to access. 

### What is expected?
If I have router guard enabled for a route, then the route should not be accessed if the guard logic is not met.

### What is actually happening?
The protected route can be accessed if I navigate to the protected route from the page where it redirects if guard logic is not met.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Router guard not working when coming from page its supposed to redirect if condition does not match" (#2139)

Getting errors like:

Refused to apply style from 'http://localhost:8080/u/xerosanyam/static/distr/stylesheets/sideshow.min.css' because its MIME type ('text/html') is not a supported stylesheet MIME type, and strict MIME checking is enabled.

Issues.Title: Vue-Router seeks and makes use of the first anchor element inside the component
Issues.Body:
### Version 3.0.1 ### Reproduction link [https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/250344/](https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/250344/) ### Steps to reproduce Make a `router-link` whose `tag` attribute is not `a`, and place an anchor element inside it. ### What is expected? The click listener should bind to self. ### What is actually happening? The click listener binds to the first inner anchor element, disregarding self. --- There are several things at play here: 1. I want the whole card to be user-clickable. 2. I prerender my pages using `prerenderer-spa-plugin` and I want only the title of the card to be an anchor element for SEO reasons. 3. Again for SEO reasons, I don't want the whole card to be an anchor element since it will also contain `Content` and `More content` as anchor text. Now I understand where this behavior is coming from, it's trying to prevent a child anchor from triggering a full page navigation. Without using `router-link` I can get the best of both worlds by making a clickable div whose event does not propagate and trigger the inner anchor while web crawlers still relate `/route/3` to `I am a good link`: ```

I am a good link

Content

More content

``` These lines are responsible for this behavior: https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/9880cbda8dd299315a253abaab69da00eecdf635/src/components/link.js#L86-L99 Note a shortcoming of this implementation: should the user place more than one anchor element inside the `router-link`, only the first one will get enhanced while the other ones will still trigger a full page reload. To me that scenario makes little sense and I have no idea of any real use case, but perhaps it should raise a warning. Is there any 'official' stance on my workaround?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Vue-Router seeks and makes use of the first anchor element inside the component" (#2134)

Issues.Title: Hash mode places # at incorrect location in URL if current query parameters exist on page load
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/zlvz65rplp](https://codesandbox.io/s/zlvz65rplp)

### Steps to reproduce
Navigate to myapp.com?foo=bar


### What is expected?
Hash is appended before query parameters, to get the final result of myapp.com/#/?foo=bar


### What is actually happening?
Hash is placed after parameters myapp.com?foo=bar#/ (also making the query parameters inaccessible with `this.$route.query`)

---
Note on codesandbox link - unable to place query parameter for initial URL in editor preview - please remove `/#/` & append `?foo=bar`

Running across this in an instance where user authentication is done outside our app, but client/user identifier is passed to our app in query parameter upon authorization.

Issues.Title: Navigating with anchor tag makes `exact` router-links lost its class
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/1340kjpvvl?autoresize=1&initialpath=%2Fa%2F1&module=%2Fsrc%2Fcomponents%2Fview.vue](https://codesandbox.io/s/1340kjpvvl?autoresize=1&initialpath=%2Fa%2F1&module=%2Fsrc%2Fcomponents%2Fview.vue)

### Steps to reproduce
(From demo page)

1. Click `Anchor tags` link, it will append `#anchor` to the href of current page
2. Click `refresh` link, just like sharing a link with a specific paragraph

### What is expected?
The link should still has its active class (but only when `mode: 'history'`)

### What is actually happening?
`vue-router` also compared its `hash`, so it's no longer `exact` and lost its class

---
I think if we're in `history mode`, it is no need to compare `route.hash`

https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/dev/src/util/route.js#L73-L94

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Navigating with anchor tag makes `exact` router-links lost its class" (#2123)

Issues.Title: Can not find module for recursive function
Issues.Body:
<!--
IMPORTANT: Please use the following link to create a new issue:

  https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vue-router

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.
-->
My vue-router's version is **^3.0.1**.
I write a lazy recursive function like following:
`function loadComponent(comppath, delay = 200, timeout = 3000, loadingComp = loadingComp, errorComp = ErrorComp) {
return function () {
    return {
      component: import(compPath),
      loading: loadingComp,
      error: errorComp,
      delay,
      timeout
    }
  }
}
// load component in async way
export default new Router({
  routes: [
    {
      path: '/',
      name: 'index',
      component: loadComponent('@/router/views/Index')
    }
 ]
})`
Vue devtool remind me errors, `vue-router.esm.js?fe87:1905 Error: Cannot find module '@/router/views/Index'.
    at eval (eval at ./src/router lazy recursive (app.js:1143), <anonymous>:5:9)`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can not find module for recursive function" (#2117)

Issues.Title: Extend <router-link> to set an aria-current attribute for active links, instead of an active class
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
This feature enables developers to mark up the active router link in an accessible manner for users of assistive technologies.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Similar to the `active-class` property on `<router-link>` introduce an `aria-current` string property, defaulting to a `null` value. When set, use the `aria-current` DOM attribute in addition to the active class.

Criteria for whether the DOM attribute should be set are the same  as for `active-class`. The attribute should be set on the DOM node itself -- or instead on the special nested `<a>` element that router-link can upgrade, should one exist.

The DOM attribute's value should be taken from the `aria-current` router-link property. Optionally, this could be validated against the list of valid options as per the ARIA 1.1 specification and console warnings could be provided on attempts to set invalid values.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Extend <router-link> to set an aria-current attribute for active links, instead of an active class" (#2116)

Issues.Title: Feature Request: watch
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
This solve doing 

store.watch multiple times

for example

store.watch multiple getter functions

### What does the proposed API look like?
when declaring a vuex store or module add a watch option on it
```js
Vuex.store({
  watch: {
    'getters.auth': {
       mutation: 'test',
       action: 'test',
       deep: true,
       immediate: true
     }
  }
})
```
Just the same idea with Vue JS API

https://vuejs.org/v2/api/#watch

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feature Request: watch" (#1219)

Issues.Title: How was the render watch added to the  property subs of a instance Dep when new Vue()
Issues.Body:
import Vue from 'vue'
import store from './store'
import App from './components/App.vue'

new Vue({
  store, // inject store to all children
  el: '#app',
  render: h => h(App)
})

Issues.Title: [feat] Add asyncData Method Type to ComponentOptions Module Augmentation
Issues.Body:
We use Vue SSR heavily at @algorithmiaio, and we've followed the [Vue SSR-sanctioned means of declaring async data methods](https://ssr.vuejs.org/en/data.html#logic-collocation-with-components).  We've shimmed together our own module augmentation for the `asyncData` method, but given the prevalence of `asyncData` usage throughout the Vue community, it would be nice to standardize the interface.

I was torn as per where this should live - there isn't a repo for SSR, given that it lives in the Vue repo, and ultimately it felt right here with the Vuex project, since `asyncData` and Vuex go hand in hand. 

I've added a test for the new type as well, and let me know if there's anything I can tweak. Cheers!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[feat] Add asyncData Method Type to ComponentOptions Module Augmentation" (#1214)

Issues.Title: e2e test command went wrong
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/blob/dev/test/e2e/runner.js](https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/blob/dev/test/e2e/runner.js)

### Steps to reproduce
npm run test:e2e --test cart.js



### What is expected?
saw the e2e test result

### What is actually happening?
something went wrong and no test result

---
when I run npm run test:e2e --test cart.js, nothing happens and no result.
I think node won't read args with '--' like '--test' as process.argv .
One snippet in test/e2e/runner.js is 
```js
var i = args.indexOf('--test')
if (i > -1) {
  args[i   1] = 'test/e2e/specs/'   args[i   1]
}
```
emm, the process.argv seems contains no '--test'

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "e2e test command went wrong" (#1213)

Issues.Title: export ActionHandler
Issues.Body:
- while testing we have methods using this method signature and it would be nice if we did not have define this.

We were running into the issue as reported in https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/7960

So workaround was to do something like
```
type ModuleAction<ModuleState> = (injectee: ActionContext<ModuleState, State>, payload: any) => any;
const loginAction = userActions.login as ModuleAction<UserState>;
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "export ActionHandler" (#1201)

Issues.Title: docs: improve API reference of watch and subscribe
Issues.Body:
* Changed the wording of `store#watch`'s 1st argument. It was actually a getter function until v1.x but the current getter is not a simple function. (fix #1141)
* Added descriptions how to unsubscribe from `subscribe` / `subscribeAction`. (fix #1194)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "docs: improve API reference of watch and subscribe" (#1195)

Issues.Title: The Vuex documentation does not document how to unsubscribe from subscribe and subscribeAction
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://vuex.vuejs.org/en/api.html](https://vuex.vuejs.org/en/api.html)

### Steps to reproduce
Refer to documentation for `subscribe` and `subscribeAction`.



### What is expected?
The API documentation (https://vuex.vuejs.org/en/api.html) references to the fact that both `subscribe` and `subscribeAction` returns a handler function that can be used to unsubscribe the listener passed into those functions.

### What is actually happening?
There is no mentioning of anyway to unsubscribe from `subscribe` and `subscribeAction`

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The Vuex documentation does not document how to unsubscribe from subscribe and subscribeAction" (#1194)

Issues.Title: Find problem when changing state using Object.assign()
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[http://jsrun.net/QZZKp/edit](http://jsrun.net/QZZKp/edit)

### Steps to reproduce
uncomment the code in dependency.mutations.SET_STATUS

```
            /* doesn't work*/ 
            // state.status = Object.assign(state.status, status)
            
            /* work */
            state.status = Object.assign({}, state.status, status)
```


### What is expected?
loading status should change to 'false' after 500ms

### What is actually happening?
loading status is always 'true'

---
what is the diff between 

Object.assign({}, state.status, status) // work

and 

Object.assign(state.status, status) // doesn't work

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Find problem when changing state using Object.assign()" (#1196)
